definition: to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
to exert oneself (bound form)
brave

sentences.english: A man called Mao Sui volunteered.
sentences.chinese: 有一个名叫毛遂的人，自告奋勇愿意同去。

sentences.english: Now let's recite the poem we learned last week. Any volunteers?
sentences.chinese: 现在背诵上周学的那首诗。谁自告奋勇？

sentences.english: A couple of ex-bulldozer operators and an ex-mason volunteered.
sentences.chinese: 几个开过推土机和当过泥瓦匠的士兵自告奋勇。

sentences.english: Let me make clear, I never volunteered to get involved in it.
sentences.chinese: 我想说明的是，我从未自告奋勇地介入这一问题。

sentences.english: ‘I could lend you some books,’Jane offered.
sentences.chinese: “我可以借你一些书，”简自告奋勇地提议。

sentences.english: O good YaoShang just volunteered to help zhao fatty again.
sentences.chinese: 阿好腰伤刚好就又自告奋勇去给赵胖子帮忙。

sentences.english: Who's willing to volunteer a reason?
Cloud elder sister come forward with girl abortion in picking up the kite.
sentences.chinese: 云姐自告奋勇，带丫鬟小月进去捡风筝。

sentences.english: A man volunteered to help them.
sentences.chinese: 一个男人自告奋勇帮助他们。

sentences.english: Teacher:Now let's recite the poem we learned last week. Any volunteers?
sentences.chinese: 现在背诵上周学的那首诗。谁自告奋勇？

sentences.english: He just volunteered to do that and made sure she got to her doctor's appointments.
sentences.chinese: 他自告奋勇这样做，以确保她与医生予约的治疗。

sentences.english: Dick saw a woman with a flat tire and offered to give her a hand with it.
sentences.chinese: 狄克见一妇人轮胎泄气，就自告奋勇帮助她补胎。

sentences.english: He volunteered as special correspondent for the conference.
sentences.chinese: 他自告奋勇当这次会议的特派记者。

sentences.english: Some people volunteered to contribute money to this end.
sentences.chinese: 有的人则自告奋勇地要为此出钱出力。

sentences.english: “To keep out rats?” volunteered my older son.
sentences.chinese: “防止老鼠跑进来”我大儿子自告奋勇答道。

sentences.english: So we have volunteered to help women like Milk.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们自告奋勇帮助像她一样的女人。

definition: Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
full of joy and expectations/animatedly
not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
see 二話不說|二话不说[er4 hua4 bu4 shuo1]
to readily consent
to tackle a difficult job (idiom)/to do sth reluctantly
to act in a supporting role/fig. to play second fiddle
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn
to volunteer for military service/to offer oneself for an assignment
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
to urge sb on
hurriedly
a bright idea suddenly occurs (idiom); to hit upon an inspiration/to be struck by a brainwave
hurriedly/in haste
to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
